name: Caleb Smith
detailed_location: Temple of the UnionHelped the Abolitionists:Lincoln MemorialCaleb's tent

topics.response_text: Not now. We can talk after the Slaver attack.
Hannibal told you about Lincoln's Memorial?

topics.topic_text: Where the hell am I supposed to get a picture of the Memorial?
topics.response_text: Our ancestors honored Lincoln's life with a display in the Museum of History. I'm hoping that a picture of the Memorial still survives in there.

topics.topic_text: I'm supposed to promise to keep this place safe. Why should I?
topics.response_text: Somebody's got to look out for those that can't look out for themselves.
The stone head is from the statue of Abraham Lincoln. Hannibal wants me to reattach it to the statue in the Memorial.

topics.topic_text: So, you used to be a slave?
topics.response_text: Long time ago. Eight years I think.

topics.topic_text: Why do you stay here? Why not keep running?
topics.response_text: We are the only hope for runaway slaves everywhere.
My former master trained me in masonry. I fix things.

topics.topic_text: I'll bet you know where I can find one.
topics.response_text: Yes. There might be one in the Museum of History. Alejandra says they have a special exhibit all about Lincoln.

description:
Caleb Smith is a 32 year-old African American Male.

A former slave turned raider who found redemption as a follower of Hannibal Hamlin and the Abolitionist movement. A skilled stonemason with a preference for melee combat.

Caleb Smith's Personality: Resilient and determined, Caleb carries the weight of his past but has found purpose in the abolitionist cause. He is loyal to Hannibal Hamlin and dedicated to restoring historical landmarks as symbols of freedom. Despite his raider past, he shows genuine remorse and a desire to atone for his previous actions.

Caleb Smith's Backstory: Born to enslaved parents in the Capital Wasteland around 2245, Caleb experienced the harsh reality of slavery from a young age. He eventually escaped his bondage and survived in the wasteland by joining a band of raiders. During his time with the raiders, he developed combat skills, particularly with melee weapons. When he learned of Hannibal Hamlin's mission to free and unite slaves, he abandoned his raider lifestyle and journeyed to the Temple of the Union. There, he became one of Hannibal's first followers, cementing his loyalty by offering his masonry skills to restore historical structures. Though skilled in combat from his raider days, Caleb is willing to expand his abilities and has begun training with firearms under the guidance of fellow abolitionist Simone Cameron.
